definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]

sentences.english: His car then swerved up the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他的车突然一个急转弯冲上了便道。

sentences.english: It's not just the brainteasers that will stump you.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅仅是能难住你的脑筋急转弯。

sentences.english: That sharp bend is a death-trap for motorists.
sentences.chinese: 那个急转弯是开汽车的人的死亡陷阱。

sentences.english: The driver found the sharp left turn very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 司机发现那个左急转弯车子很难开。

sentences.english: You'll also want to avoid tight turns, so look for slow curves and straight paths.
sentences.chinese: 还要避免急转弯，所以尽量寻找温和的弯道和直道。

sentences.english: The road makes several abrupt turnings .
Marks in the roadway seem to indicate that he skidded taking a sharp turn.
sentences.chinese: 从车道上的痕迹来看，他似乎在急转弯时打滑了。

sentences.english: It could be a swerve from a steep and quiet stretch of road.
sentences.chinese: 它可以是一段坡度陡峭但安静公路的急转弯。

sentences.english: The driver had ample time to brake or swerve and avoid the woman.
sentences.chinese: 司机有足够的时间刹车或急转弯，来避开那个女人。

sentences.english: His car was swerved to avoid bumping against the roadblock.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免撞上路障，他把车作了个急转弯。

sentences.english: The road is full of many abrupt turns.
Then both groups took the brain-teaser test again.
sentences.chinese: 随后这两组学生要再做一次脑筋急转弯测试。

sentences.english: Finally in the last lane a truck swerves and barely misses them.
sentences.chinese: 最后几步道儿上，一辆卡车一个急转弯才避开了他们。

sentences.english: Still boggled as to what the problem is?
sentences.chinese: 还是对什么问题是脑筋急转弯？

sentences.english: Turn left where the road jogs .
sentences.chinese: 到这条路急转弯处向左拐。

sentences.english: Do you like 'brain teasers' and similar puzzles?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢脑筋急转弯和类似的秘题么？

definition: to turn/to go around a corner
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
